isis.stitle: ANTILOCK RELAY VALVE: AR-1 - CLEANING AND INSPECTION

svcproc.title: Service Procedure
svcproc.para: Refer to Figure 6 for all item numbers in parentheses.

step1.para: Using mineral spirits or an equivalent solvent, clean and thoroughly dry all metal parts.

Inspect the interior and exterior of all metal parts that will be reused for severe corrosion, pitting and cracks. Superficial corrosion and\or pitting on the exterior portion of the body (Item 18, Figure 6 ) and cover (Item 7) is acceptable. Replace the entire valve if the interior of the body or cover exhibits signs of corrosion or pitting.
Inspect the bores of both the body (Item 18) and cover (Item 7) for deep scuffing or gouges. Replace the entire valve if either is found.
Make certain all air channels and exhaust passages in the valve cover (Item 7) are clear and free of obstruction.
Inspect the pipe threads in the body (Item 18). Make certain they are clean and free of thread sealant.

Wash all non-metallic components in a soap and water solution making certain to rinse and dry thoroughly. Inspect each non-metallic component for cracks, wear or distortion. Replace the entire valve if these conditions are found.
If the valve was equipped with a relay piston spring (Item 17), inspect it for signs of corrosion, pitting and cracks. Replace as necessary.
8.Inspect all air line fittings for corrosion and replace as necessary. Make certain to remove all old thread sealant before reuse.
